medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 5 years post-surgery with fatigue, excessive sweating, and exertion-related dyspnea. Initially, the patient exhibited good cardiac function; however, symptoms progressed to include significant tricuspid valve incompetence and mild pulmonary stenosis, leading to surgical correction.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previous surgical repair of a univentricular heart with septation approximately 26 years prior.
medical_history.family_history: The patient has an identical twin with normal origins of both right and left coronary arteries.
medical_history.social_history: Currently employed in the hotel business and is a father to a 3-year-old boy.
